extendedIngredients.name: fresh basil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Tablespoon fresh organic snipped basil (or 2 teaspoons dried)

extendedIngredients.name: sea-salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: sea salt and cracked pepper to taste

extendedIngredients.name: sweet onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 small organic sweet onion (such as Vidalia) thinly sliced

recipes.title: Zucchini Noodles with Sauteed Vegetables

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

recipes.instructions:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees, start a large pot of water boiling

1. Wash the zucchini and cut off both ends. Use a vegetable spiralizer or mandolin to cut the squash into noodles (hint: save any zucchini that doesnt go through the sprializer and add it to the sauteed veggies!).

2. Arrange the noodles on a parchment lined cookie sheet. Bake at 200 degrees for 10 minutes, rearranging the noodles after 5 minutes. You want the noodles to be dry to the touch, but still moist on the inside.

3. In a skillet, heat the coconut oil. Add the onions and peppers and saute until they are soft, I like my onions just shy of caramelized and I left them without stirring just long enough to be slightly blackened.

4. Add the rest of the vegetables, the garlic and the basil. Continue to cook until the mushrooms are tender.

5. Drop the zucchini noodles into boiling water for 3-5 minutes, until they are dark green and tender.

6. Drain the noodles. Arrange the noodles on two plates, then spoon the vegetables over the noodles. Top with sea salt and pepper, and sprinkle the grated cheese over it.

Make 2 servings
